titleInfo.title: Letter, Col. I.T.L. Preston in Lexington, Va., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Knoxville, Tenn. 1871 Dec. 27

mods.abstract: Colonel I.T.L. Preston wrote to J.G.M. Ramsey on December 27, 1871. He described Lexington’s Confederate cemetery, as being drab and the transportation of Arthur’s remains to Lexington more costly. He suggested that reinterment in Staunton would be a better choice. He requested a copy of Ramsey's "Annals" for his Library. He invited Ramsey and his family to be his guests if they should come to Lexington.
